	Knowledge of fibre, yarn, and fabric.

Textile Engineer Job at Lucky Fibres Limited




        
    

        
        Lucky Fibres Limited started out making Nobel Carpets and rugs but pivoted into premium hair extensions by introducing Lush Hair in 2017. Since then, Lush Hair has become Increasingly Popular with consumers for its high quality and trendy styles.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Textile Engineer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking motivated and detail-oriented Junior Textile Engineers to join our manufacturing operations in Ikorodu, Lagos.
	This role is ideal for recent graduates or early-career professionals looking to build a long-term career in manufacturing through hands-on technical exposure and structured development.


Key Responsibilities


	Support daily production processes, including fibre, yarn, and fabric manufacturing
	Assist in dyeing, finishing, and quality control (QC) activities
	Support the operation, monitoring, and basic troubleshooting of machinery
	Monitor production quality and report deviations from set standards
	Assist in data collection, documentation, and production reporting
	Participate in technical training, safety programs, and continuous improvement initiatives


Requirements


	B.Sc / B.Eng in Textile Engineering or Polymer & Textile Engineering
	0–2 years of post-graduation experience (fresh graduates are encouraged to apply)
	NYSC completed or exemption obtained
	Basic understanding of textile production processes
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
	Willingness to learn and work in a fast-paced manufacturing environment


Key Skills (Added Advantage):


	Knowledge of fibre, yarn, and fabric.
	Basic understanding of dyeing, finishing, and quality control processes
	Familiarity with textile machinery
	Good communication and teamwork skills.


Why Join Lucky Fibres Nigeria (Tolaram Group)?


	Structured hands-on technical training
	Career growth opportunities within a leading FMCG and manufacturing group
	Professional and performance-driven work environment.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Assistant Warehouse Manager",
  "description": "Apple &amp; Pears&nbsp;Limited was incorporated in the year 2012 as an Agro Allied &amp; Food Industry to produce soya meal, concentrate and finished feed for the poultry industry, and refined edible oil, mayonnaise, ketchup, salad cream, vinegar,custard powder and Chocolate Drink for the Nigerian market.

The company has invested millions of dollars in land, building, construction of infrastructural facilities and machinery, with one goal in mind and that is to have an integrated facility encompassing the complete value chain of the soya bean business, from sourcing, processing, extraction, refining, packaging and distribution of a wide range of premium products. In response to environmental concerns, we have installed solar panels to partially power the plant on&nbsp;solar energy&nbsp;also we have a state of the art effluent treatment plant to treat and reuse the water discharged during the various production processes.

We have created strong brands such as Laziz Oil, Winner Soya Oil, Active Oil, La Mayo Mayonnaise, Laziz Ketchup, Laziz Salad Cream, Laziz Thousand Island, Laziz Vinegar, Laziz Custard, Laziz Chocolate Drink, A1 Soya Bean Meal, A1 Soya Lecithin, HI Pro Concentrate and HI Pro Feed.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Warehouse Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Sagamu, Ogun

Job Summary


	Apple and Pears Limited is seeking a highly organized and reliable Assistant Warehouse Manager to support daily warehouse operations.
	The successful candidate will assist in inventory management, staff supervision, and ensuring efficient storage and dispatch of goods.
	Proximity to Sagamu is a key requirement, as punctuality and availability are critical to this role.


Job Description / Responsibilities


	Assist the Warehouse Manager in overseeing daily warehouse operations
	Monitor inventory levels and ensure accurate record-keeping
	Coordinate receiving, storage, and dispatch of goods
	Supervise warehouse staff and ensure compliance with company procedures
	Ensure proper handling, storage, and safety of warehouse items
	Support periodic stock counts and audits
	Maintain cleanliness, orderliness, and security of the warehouse
	Prepare basic warehouse reports as required.


Qualifications


	Minimum of an&nbsp;OND / HND / BSc Degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field
	Professional certifications in warehouse or logistics management will be an added advantage


Experience:


	Minimum of 2 - 4 years of relevant experience in warehouse operations or inventory management
	Prior experience in a supervisory or assistant managerial role is preferred


Additional Requirements:


	Must reside in Sagamu or nearby locations (proximity is very important)
	Strong organizational and leadership skills
	Basic computer knowledge (Excel, inventory systems)
	Good communication and problem-solving skills
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines


Salary
N200,000 monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr1appleandpears@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Assistant Warehouse Manager Job at Apple and Pears Limited




        
    

        
        Apple & Pears Limited was incorporated in the year 2012 as an Agro Allied & Food Industry to produce soya meal, concentrate and finished feed for the poultry industry, and refined edible oil, mayonnaise, ketchup, salad cream, vinegar,custard powder and Chocolate Drink for the Nigerian market.
     

            
    



The company has invested millions of dollars in land, building, construction of infrastructural facilities and machinery, with one goal in mind and that is to have an integrated facility encompassing the complete value chain of the soya bean business, from sourcing, processing, extraction, refining, packaging and distribution of a wide range of premium products. In response to environmental concerns, we have installed solar panels to partially power the plant on solar energy also we have a state of the art effluent treatment plant to treat and reuse the water discharged during the various production processes.

We have created strong brands such as Laziz Oil, Winner Soya Oil, Active Oil, La Mayo Mayonnaise, Laziz Ketchup, Laziz Salad Cream, Laziz Thousand Island, Laziz Vinegar, Laziz Custard, Laziz Chocolate Drink, A1 Soya Bean Meal, A1 Soya Lecithin, HI Pro Concentrate and HI Pro Feed.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Warehouse Manager

Job Location: Sagamu, Ogun

Job Summary


	Apple and Pears Limited is seeking a highly organized and reliable Assistant Warehouse Manager to support daily warehouse operations.
	The successful candidate will assist in inventory management, staff supervision, and ensuring efficient storage and dispatch of goods.
	Proximity to Sagamu is a key requirement, as punctuality and availability are critical to this role.


Job Description / Responsibilities


	Assist the Warehouse Manager in overseeing daily warehouse operations
	Monitor inventory levels and ensure accurate record-keeping
	Coordinate receiving, storage, and dispatch of goods
	Supervise warehouse staff and ensure compliance with company procedures
	Ensure proper handling, storage, and safety of warehouse items
	Support periodic stock counts and audits
	Maintain cleanliness, orderliness, and security of the warehouse
	Prepare basic warehouse reports as required.


Qualifications


	Minimum of an OND / HND / BSc Degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field
	Professional certifications in warehouse or logistics management will be an added advantage


Experience:


	Minimum of 2 - 4 years of relevant experience in warehouse operations or inventory management
	Prior experience in a supervisory or assistant managerial role is preferred


Additional Requirements:


	Must reside in Sagamu or nearby locations (proximity is very important)
	Strong organizational and leadership skills
	Basic computer knowledge (Excel, inventory systems)
	Good communication and problem-solving skills
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines


Salary
N200,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr1appleandpears@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Hospitality Manager (Short-let & Hotel)  Job at Sujimoto Construction Limited




        
    

        
        Sujimoto Construction Limited is a luxury real estate and construction company with a vision to dominate Nigeria's real estate industry. The firm covers all areas of construction, including the pre and post phases. Our major expertise is in luxury real estate development. We have also expanded our operations into facility management and direct construction, catering to the discerning real estate investor who wishes to be associated only with bespoke and iconic structures.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Hospitality Manager (Short-let & Hotel) 

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Job
     

            
    




	We are seeking a results-oriented Hospitality Manager with sales experience and a strong background in short-let apartments, Airbnb operations, hotels, or related hospitality services.
	The ideal candidate will oversee end-to-end property operations, ensure exceptional guest experiences, optimize occupancy and revenue, and maintain high service standards across all platforms.


Responsibilities


	Manage daily operations of short-let units, serviced apartments, and/or hotel properties
	Oversee Airbnb and OTA listings (pricing, availability, content accuracy, and performance)
	Ensure excellent guest experience from booking to check-out, including service recovery
	Lead, train, and supervise operational teams (front desk, housekeeping, maintenance, and vendors)
	Monitor occupancy rates, guest reviews, and revenue performance; implement improvement strategies
	Coordinate housekeeping schedules, quality checks, and property readiness
	Handle guest feedback, complaints, and platform reviews professionally
	Control operational budgets, costs, and supplier contracts
	Ensure compliance with health, safety, and regulatory requirements
	Collaborate with sales and marketing teams to maximize bookings and brand visibility.


Requirements


	Proven experience managing short-let, Airbnb, serviced apartments, or hotel operations
	Strong experience in Sales.
	Strong understanding of OTA platforms (Airbnb, Booking.com, Agoda, Expedia, etc.)
	Experience in revenue management, pricing strategies, and occupancy optimization
	Excellent leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills
	Strong operational and organizational capabilities
	Ability to work flexible schedules, including weekends and peak seasons
	Proficiency in PMS, channel managers, and hospitality reporting tools.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: best@sujimotonig.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
